name: Crashed Ship
desc: A vessel of some kind has crashed into the surface of this asteroid. Wreckage from the craft can still be found within the impact crater.

name: Unknown Origin
desc: The material composition of this asteroid differs significantly from its neighbors. It likely has a different origin than the other bodies of this asteroid belt, and should be investigated more closely.

name: Covered in Debris
desc: The surface of this asteroid is littered with metallic debris. Most of it appears to originate from starships of many different designs.

name: Energy Emissions
desc: Strong energy emissions of an unknown origin make this asteroid stand out from the rest of its peers in this crowded asteroid field.

name: Docking Hatch
desc: A small docking hatch leading to the interior of this asteroid is visible at the rim of a small crater on its surface. The hatch was likely concealed once, but it has since been exposed by micrometeorite impacts.

name: Asteroid Collision
desc: This asteroid recently suffered an impact from another body within the asteroid belt, which resulted in a slightly changed orbit and a massive crater on the surface.

name: Abandoned Station
desc: A small space station of some kind has been built in a stable orbit around this asteroid. It appears deserted.

name: Life Signs
desc: We are picking up life signs coming from somewhere within the interior of this asteroid. This definitely warrants a closer investigation.

name: Atmospheric Object
desc: Sensor echoes have indicated the presence of some kind of unidentified object deep within the atmosphere of this gas giant.

name: Promising Moon
desc: One of the small moonlets orbiting this gas giant has been identified as a promising mining site. A more thorough survey will have to be conducted to determine whether a mining operation would be feasible or not.

name: Life Signs
desc: Life signs have been detected coming from inside the atmosphere of this gas giant. Could it indicate the presence of some kind of biosphere?

name: Atmospheric Storms
desc: Massive storms are visible in the upper atmosphere of this gas giant. It might be worth the effort to study them in more detail.

name: Aerostat Structures
desc: Some kind of unknown structures are floating in this gas giant's upper atmosphere. They appear to be using aerostatic lift to remain buoyant.

name: Cargo Pod
desc: A small cargo pod has been left to drift in space above this gas giant. It has been captured by the planet's gravity well, and will eventually be pulled into its atmosphere.

name: Space Debris
desc: There is a significant amount of debris in orbit around this gas giant. Most of it appears to come from long lost starships of various configurations.

name: Massive Impact
desc: A colossal impact crater hints that something big collided with the surface of this [Root.GetPlanetMoon] once.

name: Unusual Energy Readings
desc: We briefly detected some unusual energy readings emanating from this [Root.GetPlanetMoon]. It might have been a glitch in our systems, or it could be a sign of something more.

name: Weak Signal
desc: By chance, we stumbled upon a faint alien signal during the survey of this [Root.GetPlanetMoon]. The source appears to be a small object in orbit. The signal contains no message - could it be a distress transponder?

name: Asteroid in Orbit
desc: A class-12 asteroid orbits this [Root.GetPlanetMoon]. The small planetoid's orbit appears far too stable for its presence to be a natural occurrence.

name: Solar Sailer
desc: An abandoned ship has been left to drift aimlessly above this [Root.GetPlanetMoon]. The massive sails protruding from its hull suggest that it relied on solar power to function.

name: Life Signs
desc: Despite the toxic content and high pressure of this [Root.GetPlanetMoon]'s atmosphere, strong life signs have been detected coming from its surface.

name: Life Signs
desc: At first glance this [Root.GetPlanetMoon] does not seem capable of supporting living beings, but nevertheless we have detected life signs emanating from somewhere beneath its frozen surface.

name: Life Signs
desc: We have detected life signs coming from somewhere beneath the barren and lifeless surface of this [Root.GetPlanetMoon]. What manner of organism could possibly live there?

name: Signs of Battle
desc: A large amount of ship debris can be found in orbit around this [Root.GetPlanetMoon], possibly the remnants of some kind of massive fleet action.

name: Ancient Shipyard
desc: An ancient orbital shipyard drifts in silence above this world. It has suffered significant battle damage, and entire sections of the facility are missing.

name: Signs of Former Habitation
desc: This toxic and lifeless world appears to have once been inhabited by a moderately advanced pre-space civilization. The ruins of their cities are still strewn across the surface.

name: Surface Writing
desc: There is significant scarring on the surface of this world in a pattern that cannot be natural. From orbit, the massive rifts look almost like writing.

name: Surface Beacon
desc: We are receiving a weak signal from the surface of this [Root.GetPlanetMoon]. The source appears to be some kind of tracking beacon.

name: Strange Mountain Formation
desc: Efforts to map the surface of this [Root.GetPlanetMoon] have identified a strange mountain range in the southern hemisphere. It does not appear to have formed naturally.

name: Unidentified Object
desc: A small rectangular object on the surface of this [Root.GetPlanetMoon] is deflecting all scanning beams like a mirror. Our sensors are unable to determine its material composition.

name: Gas Giant Signal
desc: We are picking up what may be a faint transmission coming from somewhere deep inside the atmosphere of this gas giant. Could someone - or something - be trying to communicate?

name: Gas Giant Ship
desc: The sensor profile of a mid-sized vessel was briefly detected inside the upper atmosphere of this gas giant.

name: Terminal Orbit
desc: A small and otherwise insignificant moon orbiting this gas giant appears to be on a trajectory that will soon result in a collision with its primary.

name: Nuclear Wasteland
desc: This world has been thoroughly ravaged in a nuclear war.

name: Peculiar Crater
desc: A large impact crater has been discovered that does not seem to be a natural occurrence.

name: Signs of Ancient Life
desc: [Root.GetName] exhibits signs of once having been home to an ancient civilization.

name: Strange Emissions
desc: Unexpected emissions are coming from the underground caves on [From.GetName]. Could these be a signal of some sort?

name: Lost Soul
desc: We have found a heavily damaged bipedal robot floating in space. We do not understand its energy source, but we may be able to retrieve information from its memory.

name: On Solar Sails
desc: We have found the wreckage of an archaic spaceship with an unusual design. We're not quite sure how its propulsion system works.

name: Crash Site
desc: We have discovered an ancient alien starship lying half-buried in an asteroid crater.

name: Asteroid Waves
desc: The asteroid [Root.GetName] is emitting some form of radiation in controlled bursts. Is someone - something - trying to communicate with us?

name: Debris Field
desc: Sensors report a number of possible points of interest within the dense debris field surrounding [Root.GetName].

name: A Lush Planet
desc: [Root.GetName] is exceptionally green, and preliminary scans indicate that there might be several articles of interest on the surface.

name: Monoliths
desc: Impressive structures litter [Root.GetName]'s surface, practically begging for some archaeological work.

name: Playful Ruins
desc: Impressive structures litter a small area on the surface of [Root.GetName], practically begging for some archaeological work.

name: An Asteroid, Carved
desc: [Root.GetName] has been partially hollowed out and carved with exquisite precision. There is something familiar about the lines and curves etched into the rock...

name: What Hums in the Night
desc: There is a pattern of unusual sonic activity on [Root.GetName].

name: Ice Ice Giant
desc: It seems [Root.GetName] is lacking the hydrogen and helium to be classified as a proper gas giant and is, in fact, an ice giant.

name: Radiating Asteroid
desc: [Root.GetName] periodically spews an alarmingly eclectic mix of particles and radiation into the void.

name: Pigment Poison
desc: [Root.GetName]'s toxic biosphere gives the planet a unique color scheme.

name: Cold Wastes
desc: Sensors pick up unexpected activity from an isolated point on [Root.GetName]'s frozen surface.

name: Scurrying
desc: Irregular patterns of movement have been detected within the dense tropical undergrowth of [Root.GetName].

name: On the Barren Plains
desc: A cursory scan of the planet's surface reveals a weak signal pulsing into the darkness of space.

name: Projecting
desc: According to preliminary scans, [Root.GetName] is exhibiting several strange properties and gives readings that are not at all in line with what one would expect from a planet of this type...

name: Kaleidoscopic
desc: Vaguely-defined shapes swirl with the currents in [Root.GetName]'s vast oceans.

name: Heated Rhythm
desc: Sensors pick up rhythmic movement on the hellish surface of [Root.GetName].

name: Steamrolled
desc: [Root.GetName] seems to exhibit one, and only one, interesting geological feature...

name: Dimensional Disturbance
desc: The debris field which [Root.GetName] is part of roils and swirls under the influence of unknown forces.

name: Spotty Greenery
desc: Optical scans indicate that the surface of [Root.GetName] is unusually verdant in places.

name: A Glint of Metal
desc: Backscattering spectrometry sensors indicate the presence of valuable substances in the planet's crust.

name: Atmospheric Anomaly
desc: Atmospheric readings from [Root.GetName] do not match simulated projections.

name: Winking
desc: Repeated scans of [Root.GetName]'s surface give inconsistent sensor readings, almost as if the planet itself was in a constant state of upheaval.

name: Ice Lit
desc: Inexplicable optical phenomena play across the surface of [Root.GetName], clearly visible from space.

name: Clouds Dance
desc: The atmospheric patterns of [Root.GetName] are highly atypical for a gas giant of modest size.

name: Paradise Anticipated
desc: As a Gaia-class planet, [Root.GetName] is expected to teem with life...

name: Something Smells
desc: Scans indicate the presence of a foreign, alien-made object on one of §H[Root.GetName]'s§! many frozen mountain tops.

name: Planetary Scars
desc: [Root.GetName]'s surface appears heavily pockmarked, which is not unusual.\n\nWhat is unusual is the regular shape of the scars, irregularly distributed. This is unlikely to be the result of meteorite impacts.

name: Icy Plains
desc: Sensors pick up unexpected activity from an isolated point on [Root.GetName]'s arctic surface.

name: Dustbowl
desc: [Root.GetName] is home to a number of exquisite impact craters. However, something breaks the visual uniformity in one of the larger craters...

name: Looking Down
desc: Optical sensors isolate a cluster of shapes on the barren surface of [Root.GetName] that could be buildings.

name: Poison-coated
desc: Backscattering spectrometry sensors indicate the presence of valuable substances beneath [Root.GetName]'s noxious clouds.

name: Mineral Cluster
desc: An unusually deliberate, geometric configuration of minerals drifts through the debris belt by [Root.GetName], and is possibly of alien origin.

name: Minesweeper
desc: Visual scans of [Root.GetName]'s surface reveal a grid pattern seemingly covering the entire planet.

name: Parked
desc: A cursory scan of [Root.GetName] yields surprising results.\n\nSomething seems to be scanning us back...

name: Dunes
desc: The atmosphere of [Root.GetName] is extremely thin, and yet something not unlike wind seems to agitate the seas of sand that make up its surface.

name: Toxic Construction
desc: Somewhere beneath [Root.GetName]'s unctuous clouds, unnatural structures silhouette themselves against the toxic surface.

name: Wooden Hegemony
desc: The surface of [Root.GetName] is dominated by particularly impressive-looking trees.

name: Rainbow in the Dark
desc: Sensors pick up unusual readings in the vicinity of [Root.GetName] - readings that are hard to explain being this close to a black hole.

name: Doppler Effect
desc: A wavering signal haunts [Root.GetName], though it does not seem to originate from the planet's surface.

name: Rubiconian Shores
desc: [Root.GetName]'s verdant plains are quiet, save for a weak but steady beacon signal.

name: Ancient Manufactory
desc: An old, seemingly abandoned structure looms over [Root.GetName], an otherwise unremarkable asteroid.

name: Tropical Oddities
desc: The initial data gathered from the tropical forests of [Root.GetName] indicate that something is out of the ordinary.

name: Mind the Minerals
desc: Initial analysis of the asteroid's composition points towards potentially interesting finds.

name: Distress Signal
desc: Our initial scans have caught an irregular signal reminiscent of our own distress patterns.

name: Odd Readings
desc: While scanning the asteroid belt our science team found some sort of irregularity.

name: A Feel For Steel
desc: The mineral composition of [Root.GetName] does not match projections.

name: Buried in the Sand
desc: The desert planet [Root.GetName] seems to conceal some buried secrets.

name: Confounding Cosmic Rays
desc: We have detected odd radiation that our Science Officer demands to investigate.

name: Drops in the Ocean
desc: Scans of [Root.GetName] return subtle readings of something beneath the surface.

name: Cold Hard Potential
desc: Our Science Officer has found an anomaly. It will require extensive probing, but could garner a substantial find.

name: Improbable Orbit
desc: Scanning the star unveils a small object in rapid orbit. Its small size and high velocity make it difficult for our sensors to isolate.

name: Astonishing Asteroids
desc: Observing the massive asteroid [Root.GetName], we have found...\n\nSomething. Further investigation is warranted.

name: Among the Vines and Trees
desc: [Root.GetName] appears to hold something of interest deep within its dense jungles.

name: Arid and Abandoned
desc: We have detected something out of the ordinary on the arid [From.GetPlanetMoon]. It seems like somebody has been here before us. Further investigation is needed.

name: Continental Findings
desc: The forests on this planetoid bear promises of interesting finds.

name: Toxicity
desc: There appears to be deliberately-crafted structures on the planet's surface, pointing toward a past long forgotten.

name: Desolate Sands
desc: The scorching heat of [Root.GetName] is within the expected range. However, there is more unusual data still being collected by our team. Further study is needed before a final report can be filed.

name: Mystical
desc: Our survey has uncovered something that can only be described by the science team as "mystical." We would need to investigate the phenomenon in more detail to unshroud this mystery.

name: The Winter of the Fallen
desc: The nuclear wasteland is evidently a sign of a previous civilization. Our scanners are picking up activity at certain locations that we should investigate.

name: Radioactive Planet
desc: We have discovered a planet containing large quantities of heavily decayed radioactive isotopes. Further investigation is warranted.

name: Arid Wastes
desc: The [From.GetPlanetMoon] is not the most welcoming of places, but if our initial scans are any indication it could hold some valuable resources.

name: Deserted Desert
desc: [Root.GetName] has significant bodies of water, and yet its landmasses are lifeless deserts. Further study is warranted.

name: A Strange Resonance
desc: Our scientists have discovered what first appeared to be a sensor malfunction near the corona of [root.GetName], however it's still there after rebooting. A closer look is warranted.

name: Stasis
desc: [From.GetName]'s peculiar orbit around its red dwarf star renders the planet tidally locked, and potentially worthy of further investigation.

name: Unusual Temporal Fluctuations
desc: Unusual fluctuations in spacetime have been detected in the vicinity of [From.GetName]. Further analysis is advised.

name: An Invitation
desc: A signal beacon orbits [From.GetName], beckoning travelers nearer. On the asteroid, a giant metal monolith looms, its purpose unknown.

name: Living Asteroid
desc: Rock samples retrieved from the asteroid belt unexpectedly contain a large amount of biological tissue.

name: Strange Debris
desc: Scans have identified a debris field of uncertain origin. Could this have something to do with the abandoned science ship patrolling the system?

name: Ancient Battlefield
desc: A long-forgotten battlefield where ancient empires once fought for supremacy of the galaxy - now all that remains are the vessels of those who fought under their banners.

name: Strange Readings
desc: This planet emits strange magnetic waves, quite unlike anything we have seen so far, almost as if it is trying to communicate with us. It is only logical to investigate this unusual phenomenon - we may have just encountered an extraordinary example of life on a planetary scale.

name: Mysterious Heat
desc: Whilst surveying [From.GetName], the science team detected unusual heat signatures coming from below the frozen surface of the planet.

name: The Missing Planets
desc: There are an unusual amount of hyperlanes in this system. Usually, we would dismiss these as too small to facilitate a spaceship, but the sheer amount is intriguing in and of itself.

name: Thin Ice
desc: The superficial layer of surface ice on [From.GetName] covers an abnormally large crystal deposit. We are also detecting the presence of a faint signal.

name: The Orb
desc: We have discovered powerful concentrated energy in the form of an orb. Investigation is advised.

name: Rapid Desertification
desc: Aerial images taken of [From.Planet.GetName]'s rapidly diminishing vegetation could indicate the presence of an unidentified life form habiting its surface.

name: Universe Breach Detected
desc: The dim Seddom system houses a tear in the fabric of the universe. Even more unusual, the tear itself is gradually shrinking, as if something or someone is working to repair it.

name: Spiky Readings
desc: We have detected intermittent energy spikes coming from the planet. These readings indicate something powerful, and far beyond the capabilities of the pre-sapient inhabitants we've observed.

name: $pc_astral_scar$
desc: We have discovered an anomalous rift in space and time. The closer we get, the less the known laws of physical relativity hold purchase.\n\nStudying this phenomenon could very well push our scientific understanding of the mechanics of the universe to a higher level.

name: Bright Object Detected
desc: A brightly lit object has been detected on an asteroid in §Y[from.System.GetName]§!.\n\nConstructed of highly advanced materials, it is broadcasting a steady stream of radio waves on all frequencies. Our scanners indicate no explosive or volatile compounds contained within. It seems safe to approach and study further.

name: $sc_black_hole$ Instability
desc: Our scanners have detected significant deviations from the expected physical properties of the black hole in the [from.System.GetName] system. Its gravitational forces are unpredictable, resulting in noticeable temporal inconsistencies from one point in space to another.

name: Spontaneous Explosions
desc: We have detected spontaneous explosions on the surface of §Y[this.GetName]§!. With no orbiting warships or detectable surface life, the cause of these massive blasts remains unknown.

name: Ancient Shelter
desc: We have identified several obscured subterranean structures on [From.Planet.GetName] that appear to be of considerable age. We should take this opportunity to investigate.

name: Ancient Signals
desc: We've picked up a series of strange electronic signals inside this system. Preliminary data shows these transmissions might be thousands of years old. Our crew is keen to find their origin.

name: Crimson Coverage
desc: A scarlet planet was surveyed in the [From.GetStarName] system. The intensity of the color is remarkable. We should investigate.

name: The Organic Comet
desc: A cosmic storm has left behind a comet of unusual composition. It appears to be made of organic material. Our [solar_system.Owner.GetScientistPlural] are keen to investigate.

name: Existentialist Dissipation
desc: Ever since a $shroud_storm$ raged through this system, we've been receiving strange signals. However, as soon as our [Root.Owner.GetScientistPlural] try to answer this cacophony of hails, it dissipates again. They recommend sending a science vessel.

name: Confusing Composition
desc: This orbiting object has been left behind by a passing cosmic storm. It looks like a space station but scans of its structural composition is returning most confusing results. We recommend investigating.

name: But They're Cute!
desc: After a survey of [From.Planet.GetName], a strange creature was discovered. Despite having only been among us for a short time, it has already instilled a deep  desire to nurture and protect it. Further study is advised.

name: Terrestrial Telescopes
desc:
Scans performed by the [fleet.GetName] indicate the presence of a derelict space station in the [From.GetStarName] System.

It looks like it was deposited there by a passing cosmic storm. Life signs return negative, and there are no power signals of any kind. Two massive telescopes protrude from opposite sides of the station. These optical instruments appear advanced, and far too large relative to the station's size. The technology and architecture are not yet familiar to us.

We could attempt to reactivate the telescopes, as this could yield some interesting insights.

name: The Imitator
desc: A lone escape pod was spotted during a recent survey. Strangely, the pod hailed us using a data signature matching that of our own. The pod seems to have been displaced by a recent cosmic storm that passed through the system. Investigation is recommended.

name: Polychromatic Star
desc: The passing of a cosmic storm through [from.solar_system.GetName] has transformed the visual appearance of the system's star. In the aftermath of the storm, the star's coronal layer presents as a swirl of ever-changing colors, ejecting polychromatic flares in all directions. The phenomenon warrants further analysis.

name: Asteroid Triplets
desc: A passing cosmic storm deposited three new asteroids in [from.solar_system.GetName]. These celestial bodies are prone to inexplicable changes of direction, making it impossible to predict their trajectories. Further research is needed.

name: Aftermath Distress Signal
desc: In the aftermath of the §H[from.GetAffectedStormType]§! an unidentified distress signal has been detected in §H[from.solar_system.GetName]§!.

name: Cosmic Sludge
desc: Mass sensors monitoring §H[from.solar_system.GetName]§! are showing erratic readings in the aftermath of the §H[from.GetAffectedStormType]§!.\n\nSystem diagnostics show no sign of a technical error with the equipment. These readings require further investigation.

name: Shattered Satellite
desc: In the aftermath of the §H[from.GetAffectedStormType]§!, an unidentified object has been detected in §H[from.solar_system.GetName]§!. Further analysis of this debris could provide valuable insights.

name: Foreign Object
desc: Sensors in §H[from.solar_system.GetName]§! have detected an unknown object brought into the system by the recent §H[from.GetAffectedStormType]§!.\n\nCloser inspection is needed to verify the nature of the anomaly.

name: Displaced Tiyanki
desc: In the aftermath of the $default_storm$ our sensors have detected three Tiyanki signatures in §H[solar_system.GetName]§!.

name: A Curious Signal
desc: Although [Root.GetName] appears totally desolate and devoid of life, our scanners have picked up an encrypted signal emanating from it.

name: Floating Value
desc: Starlight can be seen glinting off an unusually large object, just under the ocean surface of [Root.GetName].

name: Planetscape Garden
desc: This entire world is unusually picturesque - suspiciously so, perhaps. What forces are at work that could have caused this?

name: Weapon Trails
desc: Faint traces of weapon radiation indicative of a military spacecraft have been detected on [From.GetName].

name: Alien Site
desc: Check out the alien signal

name: A Planetary Machine
desc: This planet is covered from pole to pole in rusting, ancient machinery, much of which is itself covered in an unidentified, organic tissue. What manner of creatures could have built this technological curiosity, and what happened to them?

name: Supply Ship Wreckage
desc: Sensors report a shipwreck of unidentified origin has been sighted in orbit of [Root.GetName].

name: Traces of Civilization
desc: Despite the planet's lack of atmosphere, there is evidence of some kind of artificial structures on [From.GetName] that may indicate a past civilization.

name: Rainbow in the Dark
desc: The accretion disk around [From.GetName] exhibits a remarkable refraction spectrum, not unlike that of a rainbow. What could be causing it?

name: Fleet Signatures
desc: Readings suggest the presence of an unknown fleet in orbit of [From.GetName]. They do not respond to hails.

name: Symmetrical Structures
desc: Scanners indicate an unusually high level of symmetry on the surface of [From.GetName].

name: Gray Goo
desc: The planetary body [From.GetName] appears to be covered in some manner of grayish substance, possessing strange properties and varying metallic composition.

name: Heavy Readings
desc: Highly irregular gravitational readings surround [From.GetName].

name: Movement in the Clouds
desc: There is movement in the upper atmosphere of [From.GetName], as though a ship was gliding hurriedly through the clouds.

name: Ship Fragments
desc: There are fragments of an unknown vessel in close orbit of [From.GetName].

name: Murky Vats
desc: Initial imaging of the ruined [From.GetName] ring world indicates a number of intact vats located on some of the dilapidated sections. Whatever these vats might hold is unknown.

name: Secret Heart
desc: Resonance imaging of the [From.GetName] asteroid suggests an internal composition consisting of rare crystals.

name: Silent Behemoth
desc: [From.GetName] is remarkably aspherical, possessing some sort of enormous formation on its surface that defies geological models.

name: Webwork
desc: Glowing webs of an unknown origin periodically illuminate the surface of [From.GetName].

name: Familiar Compounds
desc: The emission spectra of [From.GetName] suggest the gas giant's primary composition has the same molecular structure as a popular inebriant.

name: Resonant Crystals
desc: Scans of [From.GetName] reveal a continental crust filled with resonant crystals. We may be able to make some use of them.

name: Attractive Magnetism
desc: [From.GetName]'s magnetosphere is highly appealing to our research drones in orbit, for reasons they cannot explain. We should investigate further.

name: Bizarre Blanket
desc: Entire continents on [From.GetName] are blanketed in a strange growth that seems at odds with the rest of the planet's flora.

name: Inconsistent Readings
desc: The measured surface temperature of [From.GetName] is in the hundreds of degrees, despite its frozen surface. What could be causing these discrepancies?

name: Impenetrable Clouds
desc: The atmosphere of [From.GetName] is reflecting our sensors at radio frequencies. Something down there is interfering with our signals.

name: Deep Tunnels
desc: Scans suggest an intricate system of tunnels lies hidden beneath the waters of [From.GetName]. What could have created them?

name: Dilapidated Station
desc: Scarred by centuries of debris impacts, a dilapidated relic of a station hangs in orbit, trailing wearily behind [From.GetName]. Its decrepit state and unrecognized technology will require a team of specialists to investigate.

name: Doppelgangers
desc: The primitives eking out an existence on the ashy plains of [From.GetName] are remarkably similar to the ones discovered on another tomb world in the same system.

name: Heavy Pulse
desc: [From.GetName] pulses steadily, its helioseismology indicating an internal composition far denser than expected. What could be responsible for this surprising density?

name: Volcanic Vents
desc: A remarkable array of gases are being vented on [From.GetName] - ones not usually found on molten worlds. Some of these gases show promising industrial value.

name: Deep Caverns
desc: Interior imaging of [From.GetName] suggests massive underground caverns wait below the planet's surface. They may be worth investigation.

name: Mysterious Construct
desc: Some manner of artificial structure peaks out from between the toxic clouds of [From.GetName]'s atmosphere.

name: Abandoned Settlements
desc: Scans of [From.GetName] reveal what appear to be the abandoned settlements of a primitive society. What manner of fate could have befallen their builders?

name: Waterless Canyons
desc: Canyons deep enough to be seen from orbit furrow the surface of [From.GetName], yet the planet is dry as a dustbowl. What could have happened to the water that once so profoundly carved [From.GetName]'s' stone?

name: Megaflora
desc: Plant life of truly incredible proportions dominates the landscape of [From.GetName], its vibrant colors and gargantuan size almost calling to our xeno-biologists.

name: Haunting Sea
desc: There is something unusual, almost hypnotic about the soft undulations of the sea covering [From.GetName]. Its motions match no known projections for tidal behavior.

name: Isolated Ruin
desc: Sensors indicate an isolated pinprick of artificial structures on [From.GetName].

name: Ruined Capital
desc: Our initial survey of the [From.GetName] suggests this planet is the fallen capital of a lost empire whose junkyards we have encountered prior. A more thorough investigation may yield further information.

name: Mysterious Tanker
desc: A derelict tanker of unknown origin orbits [From.GetName], its reservoirs heavy with some manner of organic substance.

name: Unidentified Drop Pods
desc: First thought to be asteroids, a halo of motionless drop pods surrounds [From.GetName].

name: Phased Planet
desc: Enigmatic energy readings surround [From.GetName], as though the entire planet is wavering in and out of existence.

name: Overgrown Ruins
desc: Sensors indicate there are artificial formations buried beneath rich vegetation on [From.GetName].

name: Interference
desc: Ship sensors are picking up an unexplained pattern of interference in the [From.GetStarName] System.

name: Unscannable Object
desc: An object that reflects our sensors has been located in the [From.GetStarName] asteroid field, near [From.GetName]. Visual observation has identified the object as polygonal in shape, but due to lack of scanner data, little else is known.

name: Metallic Crystal Formations
desc: The geoscape of [From.GetName] is dominated by what appear from orbit to be silvery, metallic crystals of dimensions never-before-seen. From orbit, they eerily resemble skyscrapers. Closer study is warranted.

name: Metallic Sands
desc: Scanners indicate the sandy dunes of [From.GetName] are almost entirely composed of granulate rare metals. Perhaps some valuable resources could be extracted from them.

name: Solid Core
desc: Despite expected projections, [From.GetName] has a particularly large solid core beneath its incredibly thick mantle of unique gases. Our scientists recommend further investigation.

name: Ancient Hulk
desc: A massive shipwreck of ancient design circles [From.GetName].

name: Deserted Star Platform
desc: A defective platform of alien design is drifting aimlessly around a star. Perhaps closer study could reveal its purpose.

name: Abandoned Observation Post
desc: A tattered old observation post circles [big_rip_planet.GetName] but there are no signs of intelligent life on its surface. Closer investigation may give us the answer to why.

name: $AST_DEBRIS_FIELD_1_CAT$
desc: Sensors report a number of possible points of interest within the dense debris field surrounding [Root.GetName].

name: $AST_DEBRIS_FIELD_1_CAT$
desc: Sensors report a number of possible points of interest within the dense debris field surrounding [Root.GetName].

name: Alien Activity
desc: Our sensors are registering energy emissions indicative of alien activity on [Root.GetName].

name: Corrupt Survey Data
desc: Something in the [From.System.GetName] system is corrupting some of our sensory data. The source of the irregularity seems to be the planet [From.GetName].

name: Irregular Energy Emissions
desc: Our sensors indicate odd irregularities in [From.GetName]'s energy emission pattern.

name: Peculiar Patterns
desc: Strange patterns, clearly visible even from space, are forming across the surface of [Root.GetName].

name: Tomb World
desc: Unusual readings suggest there may be more to this desolate world than meets the eye.

name: Alien Life
desc: Initial sensory readings from [From.GetName] suggest it could support alien life.

name: Unusual Moon
desc: There is something unusual about this moon.

name: Shielded World
desc: For reasons unknown [Root.GetName] has been enclosed within an impenetrable shield and the shield is cracking.

name: Armed Vessel
desc: Preliminary scans of [From.GetName] indicate that a heavily-armed vessel is in orbit of the asteroid. It would be wise to proceed with caution.

name: Encrypted Transmission
desc: We have come upon an encrypted datastream transmitting from a location on [From.GetName].

name: Unknown Insides
desc: Initial scans of the asteroid [From.GetName] suggest a dense mass of wrought metal within it, perhaps part of some machinery or other technology. Further scanning required for more detailed data.

name: Impossible Organism
desc: Unexpected life signs have been encountered on survey of the toxic planet [From.GetName]. Small, but significant.

name: Spacecraft Remains
desc: Bits and pieces of metal are strewn across [From.GetName]'s surface, encircling what looks like the hulk of a ship. The wreckage appears deserted, but energy readings remain.

name: Possible Inhabitants
desc: Optical scans of the planet [From.GetName] have revealed small hut-like structures littering parts of its surface, suggesting it is inhabited.

name: Alien Machine
desc: On the surface of [From.GetName] sits what appears to be a large machine, of unknown origin and purpose.

name: Orbital Speed Demon
desc: Caught in an orbit around [From.GetName] is a small, unknown object moving at such a high speed it beggars belief.

name: Light Phenomenon
desc: An unknown phenomenon has been discovered near [From.GetName]. It is causing light to be frequently refracted and occasionally even entirely blocked out.

name: Surface Signature
desc: A strange energy signature emanates from the barren and lifeless surface of [From.GetName].

name: $precursor_activity$
desc: There are signs of activity by an ancient precursor civilization on this inhospitable rock.

name: Vultaumar Prime
desc: The ancient homeworld of the Vultaum homeworld. It has seen better days.

name: Yuhtaan Majoris
desc: This world, which served as the capital of the ancient Yuht Empire, once supported life. No longer.

name: Fen Habbanis
desc: Fen Habbanis III, or simply "Fen Habbanis" as it was known to its ancient inhabitants, was the capital of the First League.

name: Irassia
desc: Whatever biosphere this world may have once supported is long gone.

name: Leaving Home
desc: During the survey of our home system we found something on [From.GetName] that did not match earlier observations made from our homeworld.

name: Orbital Debris
desc: Sensors register potentially interesting entities in orbit of [Root.GetName].

name: Surface Pings
desc: Sensors register potential finds on the surface of [Root.GetName].
